title: curriculum vitae
text:
Current Position

Since May, 2024: I am scientific staff and PhD candidate at Bielefeld University
Project: Creativity in (morpho)syntactic variation. The role of analogy
within CRC 1646: Linguistic Creativity in Communication



Previous Positions

2023 ‚Äì 2025: I was an external lecturer at Ruhr University Bochum (German studies and historical linguistics). I taught two courses on (morpho)syntax of historical German (within the generative framework) and a practice course on grammaticalization and corpus research.

title: About me
text:
Interests
I‚Äôm especially interested in (morpho)syntactic phenomena such as non-canonical passive constructions and long-distance dependencies. My work is mainly focused on German and tries to combine descriptive approaches, empirical evidence, and minimal-generative perspectives. In my dissertation and as part of my work in project A01 (), I explore whether exceptional extraction from islands can be explained by analogy. My PIs and supervisors are Jutta M. Hartmann and Andr√°s B√°r√°ny.
I‚Äôm also interested in historical linguistics and language change ‚Äì in particular, in questions such as what motivates grammaticalization processes and how these can be modeled syntactically.
